adjective.description: Allowing or characterized by great or excessive freedom of behavior.
examples: the permissive society of the 60s and 70s
I was not a permissive parent
the Hague Convention was permissive, not mandatory

adjective.description: Allowing a biological or biochemical process to occur.
examples: the mutants grow well at the permissive temperature

origin: Late 15th century (in the sense tolerated, allowed): from Old French, or from medieval Latin permissivus, from permiss- allowed, from the verb permittere (see permit).
